p: Thirty-two volatile constituents were identified, comprising a range of 90.07 ± 3.11% to 98.53 ± 0.05% of the total composition of the analyzed essential oils ( Table 2). Thymol was the major compound obtained from both fresh and dried leaves. The highest content was observed in fresh leaves (62.78 ± 0.63%), while the levels in the extracted essential oils after drying at 40, 50 and 60 °C were 49.21 ± 11.46%, 53.03 ± 11.76%, and 59.29 ± 2.89%, respectively.
